clinical_study.brief_title: Development Of An ICU Risk Score
clinical_study.official_title: I See You Risk Your ICU Capacity - Development Of An ICU Risk Score Discriminating Reasonable and Non-Reasonable ICU Admissions

The aim of this study is to evaluate the current allocation process of ICU capacities and analyze parameters important for ICU admission in an university hospital in Germany. detailed_description.textblock:
Capacity on intensive care units is limited but inevitable for high risk surgery and/or high risk patients.
Contrary, if there is no capacity on an ICU elective surgery has to be postponed. It is one of the core duties of Anesthesiologists in our hospital to identify patients with high risk for a post-surgery ICU stay upon hospital admission. We do know that there is two factors influencing the possibility of an ICU admission: The patient centered risk i.e. severe preconditions and the surgery centered risk with high possibility for perioperative complications i.e. bleeding, hemodynamic instability, pulmonary complications etc.. However, we do not know what these factors look like exactly and more importantly, how they are evaluated and weighed against each other.
The aim of this study is to evaluate the current allocation process of ICU capacities and analyze parameters important for ICU admission in an university hospital in Germany. This evaluation will be fulfilled by a data collection sheet completed by Anesthesiologists performing anesthesia in all elective and emergency surgery during a specific period of time. In a second phase a risk score for ICU admission shall be invented from parameters obtained during phase one (ICU-Risk-Score). This new score will then be evaluated in a third phase of the project.

primary_outcome.description: Development of a risk score for ICU admission consisting of patient centered risk factors (i.e. comorbidities) and surgery centered risk factors (i.e. what type of surgery is associated with a high ICU admission rate).

secondary_outcome.measure: Influence of different comorbidities on ICU admission
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of different comorbidities as risk factors for ICU admission gathered by a questionnaire filled in by the attending anesthesiologist. Statistical analysis is supposed to reveal what comorbidity (i.e. coronary artery disease) shows what impact on ICU admission.

secondary_outcome.measure: Influence of different types of surgery on ICU admission
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of different types of surgery as risk factors for ICU admission gathered by a questionnaire filled in by the attending anesthesiologist. Statistical analysis is supposed to reveal what type of surgery (i.e. vessel surgery) shows what impact on ICU admission.

arm_group.description: Patients receiving either elective or emergency surgery. Pre-conditions and type of surgery are documented. Planned and actual post-surgery observation i.e. ICU or intermediate care or post-anesthetic care unit are documented as well.

intervention.intervention_name: Patients receiving the surgery planned for them
intervention.description: No intervention will be performed apart from the surgery planned for each patient. Different aspects of data i.e. patient-centered and surgery-centered will be collected.

study_pop.textblock: All patients receiving elective or emergency surgery during phase 1 (2 months) and phase 3 (2 months) of the study, approximately 8000 in total.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients ≥ 18 years receiving surgery in the time frame of data collection
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients < 18 years
